required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Safety, Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetics of Topical ACD440 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective,Double-blind,Randomized,Placebo-controlled Study of Safety,Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetics of Topical ACD440 in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 1 b placebo-controlled study in healthy volunteers to study safety, efficacy and pharmacokinetics of Topical ACD440 on normal skin, skin optimized for penetration and skin exposed to ultraviolet radiation

detailed_description.textblock: This is an exploratory study, no primary or secondary endpoints are being defined.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Laser-evoked potentials as a tool for assessing the efficacy of antinociceptive drugs
primary_outcome.description: Not defined as primary as per protocol, but system does not seem to allow omittance of primaries

other_outcome.measure: Laser-evoked potentials as a tool for assessing the efficacy of antinociceptive drugs
Visual analog scale rating of laser induced pain
Number and percentage of subjects with adverse events
Number and percentage of subjects with clinically significant changes in 12-lead ECGs, vital signs and laboratory findings

arm_group.description: Subjects are simultaneously exposed to topical administration of ACD440 in a crossover design in separate locations from the placebo exposure.
Subjects are simultaneously exposed to topical administration of placebo in a crossover design in separate locations from the ACD440 exposure.

intervention.description: Double blind, parallel within subject comparison
Double blind, parallel within subject comparison

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteer
- Fitzpatrick skin type II or III
- Women not childbearing potential or highly effective contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy, lactation
- Drug abuse
- Clinically significant illness
- Positive COVID 19 test at screening or COVID 19 infection in the past
